title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.5 EDUCATION IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Output 5 (Education in emergencies): National and subnational governments and partners have improved capacity to prevent, mitigate, prepare for, respond to and recover from disasters including climatic and non-climatic hazards for continued, quality learning of children and adolescents., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: An increasing proportion of girls and boys, across the life cycle, especially the most disadvantaged, are learning in quality, safe and inclusive environments.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5 (Education in emergencies): National and subnational governments and partners have improved capacity to prevent, mitigate,prepare for, respond to and recover from disasters including climatic and non-climatic hazards for continued, quality learning ofchildren and adolescents.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical assistance to the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology (MOECRT) for the systematic data collection and monitoring of teacher vaccination, including the development of its monitoring dashboard in collaboration with Ministry of Health (MOH). The development of a technically rigorous safe return to learning decree and guideline, which shaped the school reopening process in the country, was informed by UNICEF’s timely technical advice to both MOECRT and the MOH. As planned, UNICEF assisted two provinces to develop comprehensive safe school policies to promote safer learning environments. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:06/12/2021
